title: 105_hr2826
content: The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new part V for First-Time Homebuyer Credit in empowerment zones and enterprise communities. This new section, 1397F, provides details on the first-time homebuyer credit. The First-Time Homebuyer Credit in empowerment zones and enterprise communities allows a credit against the tax for individuals buying a principal residence, limited by income. The First-Time Homebuyer Credit in empowerment zones and enterprise communities provides a tax credit for individuals buying a principal residence, limited by income thresholds. The credit is based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, with specific criteria for qualifying as a first-time homebuyer. The First-Time Homebuyer Credit in empowerment zones and enterprise communities allows individuals to claim a tax credit when purchasing a principal residence. The credit is limited by income thresholds and can be carried over to the following taxable year if it exceeds the limitation imposed by section 26(a). The section provides special rules and application guidelines for the First-Time Homebuyer Credit in empowerment zones and enterprise communities. It also includes conforming amendments related to the carryback of the credit before a specific effective date. The text discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code related to the First-Time Homebuyer Credit in empowerment zones and enterprise communities. It includes changes to subsection (a) of section 1016 and conforming amendments to the table of parts for subchapter U of chapter 1. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code regarding the First-Time Homebuyer Credit in empowerment zones and enterprise communities include changes to the table of sections for part VI of the Code. The effective date for these amendments is the date of the enactment of the Act.
